title: geometric sans on Vogue cover
content:
Sorry for the small resolution.  
Large x-height, very pointy angles on /A/M/N/W/, vertical sides to /M/, Futura-like single-story /a/, Helvetica-like /e/ with horizontal terminal, narrow /E/F/.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018033143im_/http:/typophile.com/files/jessica-biel-vogue-february-2010-cover_4302.jpg)
author: eliason

comments.content:
Probably custom designed for Vogue. You might be able to replicate something like this with a mix of Chalet and Neutraface No.2 from House.

- Mike Yanega
